name: Lawrence L. Larmore
content: Lawrence L. Larmore Home University of Nevada Las Vegas Howard R. Hughes College of Engineering School of Computer Science School of Computer Science My Home Page Lawrence L. Larmore On May 24, 2006, permissions were inadvertently changed on the College of Engineering server. Many of my web pages became unreadable to the public. As of today, June 20, I believe I have restored the correct permissions. If I have overlooked some page, please let me know. ProfessorÂ  of Computer Science Spring 2006: CS 302 Introduction to Data Structures Spring 2006: CS 456/656 Automata and Formal Languages Past Member, Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton, NJ Gastwissenschaftler at the University of Bonn Treasurer, STOC 98 General Chair, STOC 99 Local Arrangements Chair, FOCS 2001, October 2001, Las Vegas, NV Conference Chair, STOC 2003, June 2003, San Diego, CA Mailing Address: School of Computer Science University of Nevada Las Vegas Las Vegas, NV 89154-4019 Phone: 702 895 1096 (extension 51096 from a campus telephone) Office: TBE B378B (one of the brand-new offices, where the patio used to be) Email: larmore@cs.unlv.edu Teaching Research Research: Dynamic Programming with Emphasis on using Monge Properties, and Applications to String Matching, Matrix Searching, and Optimal Tree Construction On-line Algorithms Publications Publications in Mathematics Publications in Computer Science Conferences and Workshops: DIMACS Workshop on Codes and Trees October 5-7, 1998, Piscataway, NJ. STOC 99 May 2-5, 1999, Atlanta, GA. ESA 99 July 16-18, 1999, Prague, Czech Republic. Special Year on Computational Complexity 2000-2001, Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton Comments about Lots of Things. Designed by Blackrook
